thig5.2:2.2: prattling on,  //////.....(Several ways to interpret this line. For example, "uttering intricate and foolish speech"; or taking 'sucittaṁ' to be an adjective referring to her body (ie, the body is intricately/beatifully embellished, and she also utters foolish speech, or speech for fools - 'bālalapanaṁ' can mean "foolish speech", "speech for fools", "speech by fools", etc.
